content: Step 1: Imagine a whole, perfect pizza. This single item—the entire pizza—is called the **WHOLE**.
Step 2: To create a fraction, we must cut the whole pizza into pieces that are exactly the **same size** (EQUAL parts).
Step 3: A fraction is simply a mathematical way to describe one or more **PARTS** of that equal WHOLE.
Step 4: When you see a fraction written (like 1/4), the **bottom number** tells you the total number of equal slices the pizza was cut into. (The total parts.)
Step 5: The **top number** tells you how many of those equal slices you are eating or looking at. (The part you choose.)
Step 6: For example, if we cut the pizza into 4 equal slices, and you take 1 slice, the fraction is **1/4** (One-fourth).
Step 7: Keep the visual of the pizza slices in your mind—it helps fractions make sense!
